content:
Hello. I'm trying to see if I'm lucky and someone can help me a bit.
I'm using use
spin::Mutex;
and want to understand how this lines works

    vga_buffer::WRITER.lock().write_str("Hello again").unwrap();
    write!(vga_buffer::WRITER.lock(), ", some numbers: {} {}", 42, 1.337).unwrap();

I don't understands how unwrap() works since the function write_str retruns (). Also lock() returns MutexGuard<'_, Writer> and write_str is defined in my own struct (Writer). I'm a bit puzzled right now.

Edit:
I think this is the answer:
The data protected by the mutex can be accessed through this guard via its Deref and DerefMut implementations.
write is not the same write_str. It yields a fmt::Result IIRC
Oh you meant the first line - yeah I'm not sure
So in each case the .unwrap() is a bit different. (thx for answering)
